Operation 'getAssets' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is incomplete and vague. Description lacks clarity about pagination, filtering capabilities, and return structure. Added specifics about pagination support, filtering options, return type (Assets object), and use cases to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description: By passing in the appropriate options, you can search for available fixed asset in the system
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve fixed assets with filtering and pagination
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of fixed assets from the system. Supports filtering by asset status and other criteria through query parameters. Returns an Assets object containing asset records and pagination information. Use this operation to search for and retrieve multiple assets based on specified search criteria.
data.reasoning: Original summary is incomplete and vague. Description lacks clarity about pagination, filtering capabilities, and return structure. Added specifics about pagination support, filtering options, return type (Assets object), and use cases to improve AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'createAsset' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is adequate but description is too minimal. Added details about required input structure (Asset object), key fields expected, return value including system-generated ID, and side effects (asset becomes available for depreciation calculations) to enable AI agents to understand when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description: Adds an asset to the system
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new fixed asset in the system. Accepts an Asset object in the request body containing asset details such as asset name, asset type, purchase date, and depreciation settings. Returns the created Asset object with assigned asset ID and system-generated fields. The asset is immediately available for use in asset management and depreciation calculations.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate but description is too minimal. Added details about required input structure (Asset object), key fields expected, return value including system-generated ID, and side effects (asset becomes available for depreciation calculations) to enable AI agents to understand when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'getAssetTypes' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary and description are vague about what 'options' are available and what is returned. Added clarity about the complete list retrieval, domain context (asset types define classification and depreciation rules), specific return structure (AssetType objects), and practical use cases for AI agents.

data.current_description: By passing in the appropriate options, you can search for available fixed asset types in the system
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve all available fixed asset types
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of all available fixed asset types configured in the system. Asset types define the classification and depreciation rules for assets. Returns an array of AssetType objects containing type details such as name, depreciation method, and useful life settings. Use this operation to populate asset type selections or validate asset type assignments.
data.reasoning: Original summary and description are vague about what 'options' are available and what is returned. Added clarity about the complete list retrieval, domain context (asset types define classification and depreciation rules), specific return structure (AssetType objects), and practical use cases for AI agents.

message: Operation 'createAssetType' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is adequate but description lacks essential details. Added information about input structure (AssetType object), key configuration fields, return value with system-generated ID, and side effects (availability for asset assignment and impact on depreciation) to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description: Adds an fixed asset type to the system
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new fixed asset type in the system. Accepts an AssetType object in the request body containing type configuration such as name, depreciation method, useful life, and book depreciation settings. Returns the created AssetType object with assigned type ID. The new asset type becomes immediately available for assignment to assets and affects depreciation calculations for assets using this type.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate but description lacks essential details. Added information about input structure (AssetType object), key configuration fields, return value with system-generated ID, and side effects (availability for asset assignment and impact on depreciation) to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'getAssetSettings' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original description incorrectly mentions 'asset types' instead of 'settings'. Summary is vague about what settings are retrieved. Added clarity that these are global depreciation settings, specified return type (Setting object), explained scope (system-wide defaults), and provided context about override capabilities and use cases for AI agents.

data.current_description: By passing in the appropriate options, you can search for available fixed asset types in the system
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the global fixed asset depreciation settings configured for the system. Returns a Setting object containing book depreciation configurations such as depreciation methods, useful life defaults, and other asset management parameters. These settings apply to all assets unless overridden at the individual asset level. Use this operation to understand the default depreciation rules and configuration for asset management.
data.reasoning: Original description incorrectly mentions 'asset types' instead of 'settings'. Summary is vague about what settings are retrieved. Added clarity that these are global depreciation settings, specified return type (Setting object), explained scope (system-wide defaults), and provided context about override capabilities and use cases for AI agents.
